Source code for c8_invariant_cnn

"""
This module implements an E(8)-equivariant steerable CNN as described in General E(2)-Equivariant
Steerable CNNs (Weiler & Cesa 2019).
"""
from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
import torch
from e2cnn import gspaces, nn
from scripts.escnn_extension import InteroperableGroupPooling
from scripts.basic_blocks import DenseBlock, ReduceChannelDimsBlock
from scripts.basic_blocks import DownscaleBlock, UpscaleBlock 
from scripts.basic_blocks import ActivationBlock, TwoStepConvBlock


[docs]class AbstractC8InvariantCNN(ABC, torch.nn.Module):
    """
    Abstract implementation of a C8-invariant CNN that is savable and loadable.

    Parameters 
    -----------
        kernel_size: int 
            side length of convolutions in conv blocks (default=3)
        input_channels: int 
            number of input channels (default=4)
    """
    @abstractmethod
    def __init__(self, *args):
        super().__init__()
        self.kernel_size = 3 
        self.input_channels = 4
        self.r2_act = gspaces.Rot2dOnR2(N=8)
        self.named_blocks = {}


[docs]    @abstractmethod
    def forward(self, *args):
        """
        Forward pass of the CNN. Called during model evaluation and testing.

        Arguments
        -----------
            x: escnn.nn.GeometricTensor
                tensor with an invariant type given as input
        Returns
        ---------
            out: escnn.nn.GeometricTensor
                tensor with an invariant type given as output
        """


    def __getstate__(self):
        """
        This function is called when pickling the model.
        It returns a dictionary containing all the fields of the model.

        Returns
        ----------
            state: dict
                dictionary containing all the fields of the model
        """
        state = self.state_dict().copy()
        return state

    def __setstate__(self, state):
        """
        This function is called when unpickling the model.
        It sets all the fields of the model from the dictionary.

        Arguments
        ----------
            state: dict
                dictionary containing all the fields of the model
        """
        self.__init__(state['kernel_size'])
        self.reload_from_dict(state)


[docs]    def state_dict(self, destination=None, prefix='', keep_vars=False):
        """
        Save properties of this module to a dictionary.

        Arguments
        ----------
            prefix: string (optional)
                prefix for properties in dict

        Returns
        --------
            properties: dict
                properties of this module
        """
        properties = {}

        #Get dicts for each sub-block and update properties
        for name in self.named_blocks:
            block_dict = getattr(self, name).get_save_dict(prefix=name)
            properties.update(block_dict)

        properties["kernel_size"] = self.kernel_size

        return properties




[docs]    def get_save_dict(self):
        """
        Save properties of this module to a dictionary.

        Arguments
        ----------
            prefix: string (optional)
                prefix for properties in dict

        Returns
        --------
            properties: dict
                properties of this module
        """
        properties = {}

        #Get dicts for each sub-block and update properties
        for name in self.named_blocks:
            block_dict = getattr(self, name).get_save_dict(prefix=name)
            properties.update(block_dict)

        properties["kernel_size"] = self.kernel_size

        return properties




[docs]    def reload_from_dict(self, properties):
        """
        Load this module from a state dictionary.

        Arguments
        ----------
            properties: dict
                dictionary containing properties

        """
        #Load blocks
        for name, block_type in self.named_blocks.items():
            #Get properties dict for each block
            block_dict = {}
            for key, val in properties.items():
                if key.split('.')[0] == name:
                    block_dict[key] = val

            #Load block from dict and set value in cnn
            block = block_type.load_from_dict(block_dict)
            setattr(self, name, block)




[docs]    @classmethod
    def load_from_dict(cls, properties):
        """
        Load this module from a state dictionary.

        Arguments
        ----------
            properties: dict
                dictionary containing properties

        Returns
        --------
            module: C8InvariantCNN
                module implementing properties
        """
        #Initialize C8InvariantCNN
        cnn = cls(kernel_size=properties["kernel_size"])
        cnn.reload_from_dict(properties)
        return cnn



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def downscale(in_type, kernel_size=2, padding=0):
        """
        This function returns a "downscaling block" that reduces the dimensions of an
        input tensor through pooling.

        Arguments
        -----------
             in_type: escnn.nn.FieldType
                input type of dense block, giving invariant representation of block input

        Returns
        --------
            downscale_block: DownscaleBlock
                module that downscales an input tensor
        """
        out_type = in_type
        return DownscaleBlock(in_type, out_type, kernel_size=kernel_size,
                padding=padding), out_type



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def upscale(in_type, scale_factor=2):
        """
        This function returns an "upscaling block" that increases the dimensions of an
        input tensor through upsampling.

        Arguments
        -----------
             in_type: escnn.nn.FieldType
                input type of dense block, giving invariant representation of block input

        Returns
        --------
            upscale_block: escnn.nn.SequentialModule
                module that upscales an input tensor
        """
        out_type = in_type
        return UpscaleBlock(in_type, out_type, scale_factor=scale_factor), out_type



[docs]    def get_invariant_input_type(self, channels):
        """
        Gets an escnn.nn.FieldType corresponding to an invariant representation of a CNN
        with a given number of channels.

        Arguments
        ----------
            channels: int
                number of channels for input to next layer

        Returns
        ---------
            escnn.nn.FieldType
                input to next layer
        """
        return nn.FieldType(self.r2_act, round(channels)*[self.r2_act.trivial_repr])




[docs]class C8InvariantCNN(AbstractC8InvariantCNN, torch.nn.Module):
    """
    This class implements a C8-invariant Dense CNN that takes in 144x144xN tensor inputs and
    returns a 144x144x1 cloud mask.

    Parameters 
    ------------
        kernel_size: int 
            side length of convolutions in DenseBlocks (default=3)
        input_channels: int 
            number of input channels (default=4)
    """
    def __init__(self, kernel_size=3, input_channels=4):
        super().__init__()

        #Model is equivariant under rotations by 45 degrees (C8)
        self.r2_act = gspaces.Rot2dOnR2(N=8)
        self.f_1, self.f_2, self.f_3, self.f_4, self.f_5 = 32, 64, 128, 256, 512
        self.k_1, self.k_2, self.k_3, self.k_4, self.k_5 = 8, 16, 32, 64, 128
        self.kernel_size = kernel_size 

        #First convolution (144x144x4 -> 144x144x16)
        input_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(input_channels)
        self.input_type = input_type
        input_conv_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_1/2)
        self.input_conv_block = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(input_type, input_conv_output_type)

        #Second convolution (dense) + downscale (144x144x16 -> 72x72x32)
        conv_1_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_1)
        self.dense_conv_block_1 = DenseBlock(input_conv_output_type, conv_1_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size)
        self.downsample_1, downsample_1_output_type = self.downscale(conv_1_output_type)

        #Third convolution (dense) + downscale (72x72x32 -> 36x36x64)
        conv_2_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_2)
        self.dense_conv_block_2 = DenseBlock(downsample_1_output_type, conv_2_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size)
        self.downsample_2, downsample_2_output_type = self.downscale(conv_2_output_type)

        #Fourth convolution (dense) + downscale (36x36x64 -> 18x18x128)
        conv_3_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_3)
        self.dense_conv_block_3 = DenseBlock(downsample_2_output_type, conv_3_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size)
        self.downsample_3, downsample_3_output_type = self.downscale(conv_3_output_type)

        #Fifth convolution (dense) + downscale (18x18x128 -> 9x9x256)
        conv_4_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_4)
        self.dense_conv_block_4 = DenseBlock(downsample_3_output_type, conv_4_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size)
        self.downsample_4, downsample_4_output_type = self.downscale(conv_4_output_type)

        #Sixth convolution (dense bottleneck) (9x9x256 -> 9x9x512)
        conv_5_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_5)
        self.dense_conv_block_5 = DenseBlock(downsample_4_output_type, conv_5_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size)

        #Now time to upscale! (9x9x512 -> 18x18x256)
        upscale_1_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_5)
        self.upscale_1, upscale_1_output_type = self.upscale(conv_5_output_type)

        #Reduce channels with 1x1 conv before concatenation (18x18x512 -> 18x18x256)
        reduce_1a_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_4)
        self.reduce_1a = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_1_output_type,
                reduce_1a_output_type)

        #1x1 conv block on concatenated inputs (18x18x512 -> 18x18x128)
        reduce_1_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_4/2)
        self.reduce_1 = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_1_output_type,
                reduce_1_output_type)

        #Dense block (18x18x128 -> 18x18x256)
        conv_6_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_4)
        self.dense_conv_block_6 = DenseBlock(reduce_1_output_type, conv_6_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size)

        #Repeat upscale, concat, conv, dense (18x18x256 -> 36x36x128)
        upscale_2_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_4)
        self.upscale_2, upscale_2_output_type = self.upscale(conv_6_output_type)
        reduce_2a_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_3)
        self.reduce_2a = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_2_output_type,
                reduce_2a_output_type)
        reduce_2_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_3/2)
        self.reduce_2 = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_2_output_type,
                reduce_2_output_type)
        conv_7_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_3)
        self.dense_conv_block_7 = DenseBlock(reduce_2_output_type, conv_7_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size)

        #Repeat upscale, concat, conv, dense (36x36x128 -> 72x72x64)
        upscale_3_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_3)
        self.upscale_3, upscale_3_output_type = self.upscale(conv_7_output_type)
        reduce_3a_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_2)
        self.reduce_3a = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_3_output_type,
                reduce_3a_output_type)
        reduce_3_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_2/2)
        self.reduce_3 = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_3_output_type,
                reduce_3_output_type)
        conv_8_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_2)
        self.dense_conv_block_8 = DenseBlock(reduce_3_output_type, conv_8_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size)

        #Repeat upscale, concat, conv, dense (72x72x64 -> 144x144x32)
        upscale_4_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_2)
        self.upscale_4, upscale_4_output_type = self.upscale(conv_8_output_type)
        reduce_4_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_1/2)
        self.reduce_4 = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_4_output_type,
                reduce_4_output_type)
        conv_9_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_1)
        self.dense_conv_block_9 = DenseBlock(reduce_4_output_type, conv_9_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size)

        #Final output (1x1 conv to go to 144x144x1, then group pooling)
        final_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(1)
        self.group_reduce_block = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(conv_9_output_type, final_output_type)
        self.group_pool_block = InteroperableGroupPooling(final_output_type)

        #Normal torch block (not group invariant) for final 1x1 conv/BN/Relu
        self.plain_torch_block = ActivationBlock(relu_slope=0.1)

        #Dictionary mapping sub-blocks to types (for loading/saving from dictionaries)
        self.named_blocks = {}
        self.named_blocks['input_conv_block'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['dense_conv_block_1'] = DenseBlock
        self.named_blocks['dense_conv_block_2'] = DenseBlock
        self.named_blocks['dense_conv_block_3'] = DenseBlock
        self.named_blocks['dense_conv_block_4'] = DenseBlock
        self.named_blocks['dense_conv_block_5'] = DenseBlock
        self.named_blocks['dense_conv_block_6'] = DenseBlock
        self.named_blocks['dense_conv_block_7'] = DenseBlock
        self.named_blocks['dense_conv_block_8'] = DenseBlock
        self.named_blocks['dense_conv_block_9'] = DenseBlock
        self.named_blocks['downsample_1'] = DownscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['downsample_2'] = DownscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['downsample_3'] = DownscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['downsample_4'] = DownscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['upscale_1'] = UpscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['upscale_2'] = UpscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['upscale_3'] = UpscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['upscale_4'] = UpscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_1a'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_1'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_2a'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_2'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_3a'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_3'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_4'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['group_reduce_block'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['group_pool_block'] = InteroperableGroupPooling
        self.named_blocks['plain_torch_block'] = ActivationBlock

        #Save to dict + then reload to ensure that all fields are initialized
        self.reload_from_dict(self.get_save_dict())


[docs]    def forward(self, input_tensor):
        """
        This function runs the C8 invariant CNN forwards.

        Arguments
        ----------
            input_tensor: torch.Tensor
                RGB+IR images to put in the model

        Returns
        --------
            output_tensor: torch.tensor
                cloud map
        """
        #Transform input into C8-invariant GeometricTensor
        x = nn.GeometricTensor(input_tensor, self.input_type)

        print("Input shape before conversion: {}".format(input_tensor.shape))
        print("Input type: {}".format(x.type))
        print("Input shape: {}".format(x.shape))

        #Ingest layer
        x = self.input_conv_block(x) #144x144x16

        #Repeatedly downscale
        x = self.dense_conv_block_1(x) #144x144x32
        x = self.downsample_1(x) #72x72x32

        x_cat_72x72 = self.dense_conv_block_2(x) #72x72x64
        x = self.downsample_2(x_cat_72x72) #36x36x64

        x_cat_36x36 = self.dense_conv_block_3(x) #36x36x128
        x = self.downsample_3(x_cat_36x36) #18x18x128

        x_cat_18x18 = self.dense_conv_block_4(x) #18x18x256
        x = self.downsample_4(x_cat_18x18) #9x9x256

        #Bottleneck layer
        x = self.dense_conv_block_5(x) #9x9x512

        #Repeatedly upscale
        x = self.upscale_1(x) #18x18x512
        x = self.reduce_1a(x) #18x18x256

        #Important note: concatenations happen in dimension 1
        #because GeometricTensors have shape (inv_rep, channels, x, y)
        x = nn.tensor_directsum([x, x_cat_18x18]) #18x18x512
        x = self.reduce_1(x) #18x18x128
        x = self.dense_conv_block_6(x) #18x18x256

        x = self.upscale_2(x) #36x36x256
        x = self.reduce_2a(x) #36x36x128
        x = nn.tensor_directsum([x, x_cat_36x36]) #36x36x256
        x = self.reduce_2(x) #36x36x64
        x = self.dense_conv_block_7(x) #36x36x128

        x = self.upscale_3(x) #72x72x128
        x = self.reduce_3a(x) #72x72x64
        x = nn.tensor_directsum([x, x_cat_72x72]) #72x72x128
        x = self.reduce_3(x) #72x72x32
        x = self.dense_conv_block_8(x) #72x72x64

        x = self.upscale_4(x) #144x144x64
        x = self.reduce_4(x) #144x144x16
        x = self.dense_conv_block_9(x) #144x144x32

        #Final C8-invariant layer (goes to torch.tensor)
        x = self.group_reduce_block(x) #144x144x1
        x = self.group_pool_block(x) #144x144x1 torch.tensor

        #Final torch layer
        x = x.tensor #Unwrap GeometricTensor to get PyTorch tensor
        x = self.plain_torch_block(x) #144x144x1 torch.tensor

        return x



[docs]class NonDenseC8InvariantCNN(AbstractC8InvariantCNN, torch.nn.Module):
    """
    This class implements a C8-invariant CNN that takes in 144x144xN tensor inputs and
    returns a 144x144x1 cloud mask.

    Parameters 
    ------------
        kernel_size: int 
            side length of convolutions in DenseBlocks (default=3)
        input_channels: int 
            number of input channels (default=4)
    """
    def __init__(self, kernel_size=3, input_channels=4, has_bias=True):
        super().__init__()

        #Model is equivariant under rotations by 45 degrees (C8)
        self.r2_act = gspaces.Rot2dOnR2(N=8)
        self.f_1, self.f_2, self.f_3, self.f_4, self.f_5 = 32, 64, 128, 256, 512
        self.k_1, self.k_2, self.k_3, self.k_4, self.k_5 = 8, 16, 32, 64, 128
        self.kernel_size = kernel_size 

        #First convolution (144x144x4 -> 144x144x16)
        input_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(input_channels)
        self.input_type = input_type
        input_conv_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_1/2)
        self.input_conv_block = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(input_type, input_conv_output_type)

        #Second convolution (dense) + downscale (144x144x16 -> 72x72x32)
        conv_1_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_1)
        self.conv_block_1 = TwoStepConvBlock(input_conv_output_type, conv_1_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size, has_bias=has_bias)
        self.downsample_1, downsample_1_output_type = self.downscale(conv_1_output_type)

        #Third convolution (dense) + downscale (72x72x32 -> 36x36x64)
        conv_2_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_2)
        self.conv_block_2 = TwoStepConvBlock(downsample_1_output_type, conv_2_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size, has_bias=has_bias)
        self.downsample_2, downsample_2_output_type = self.downscale(conv_2_output_type)

        #Fourth convolution (dense) + downscale (36x36x64 -> 18x18x128)
        conv_3_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_3)
        self.conv_block_3 = TwoStepConvBlock(downsample_2_output_type, conv_3_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size, has_bias=has_bias)
        self.downsample_3, downsample_3_output_type = self.downscale(conv_3_output_type)

        #Fifth convolution (dense) + downscale (18x18x128 -> 9x9x256)
        conv_4_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_4)
        self.conv_block_4 = TwoStepConvBlock(downsample_3_output_type, conv_4_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size, has_bias=has_bias)
        self.downsample_4, downsample_4_output_type = self.downscale(conv_4_output_type)

        #Sixth convolution (dense bottleneck) (9x9x256 -> 9x9x512)
        conv_5_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_5)
        self.conv_block_5 = TwoStepConvBlock(downsample_4_output_type, conv_5_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size, has_bias=has_bias)

        #Now time to upscale! (9x9x512 -> 18x18x256)
        upscale_1_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_5)
        self.upscale_1, upscale_1_output_type = self.upscale(conv_5_output_type)

        #Reduce channels with 1x1 conv before concatenation (18x18x512 -> 18x18x256)
        reduce_1a_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_4)
        self.reduce_1a = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_1_output_type,
                reduce_1a_output_type)

        #1x1 conv block on concatenated inputs (18x18x512 -> 18x18x128)
        reduce_1_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_4/2)
        self.reduce_1 = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_1_output_type,
                reduce_1_output_type)

        #Dense block (18x18x128 -> 18x18x256)
        conv_6_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_4)
        self.conv_block_6 = TwoStepConvBlock(reduce_1_output_type, conv_6_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size, has_bias=has_bias)

        #Repeat upscale, concat, conv, dense (18x18x256 -> 36x36x128)
        upscale_2_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_4)
        self.upscale_2, upscale_2_output_type = self.upscale(conv_6_output_type)
        reduce_2a_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_3)
        self.reduce_2a = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_2_output_type,
                reduce_2a_output_type)
        reduce_2_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_3/2)
        self.reduce_2 = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_2_output_type,
                reduce_2_output_type)
        conv_7_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_3)
        self.conv_block_7 = TwoStepConvBlock(reduce_2_output_type, conv_7_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size, has_bias=has_bias)

        #Repeat upscale, concat, conv, dense (36x36x128 -> 72x72x64)
        upscale_3_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_3)
        self.upscale_3, upscale_3_output_type = self.upscale(conv_7_output_type)
        reduce_3a_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_2)
        self.reduce_3a = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_3_output_type,
                reduce_3a_output_type)
        reduce_3_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_2/2)
        self.reduce_3 = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_3_output_type,
                reduce_3_output_type)
        conv_8_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_2)
        self.conv_block_8 = TwoStepConvBlock(reduce_3_output_type, conv_8_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size, has_bias=has_bias)

        #Repeat upscale, concat, conv, dense (72x72x64 -> 144x144x32)
        upscale_4_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_2)
        self.upscale_4, upscale_4_output_type = self.upscale(conv_8_output_type)
        reduce_4_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_1/2)
        self.reduce_4 = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(upscale_4_output_type,
                reduce_4_output_type)
        conv_9_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(self.f_1)
        self.conv_block_9 = TwoStepConvBlock(reduce_4_output_type, conv_9_output_type, kernel_size=self.kernel_size, has_bias=has_bias)

        #Final output (1x1 conv to go to 144x144x1, then group pooling)
        final_output_type = self.get_invariant_input_type(1)
        self.group_reduce_block = ReduceChannelDimsBlock(conv_9_output_type, final_output_type)
        self.group_pool_block = InteroperableGroupPooling(final_output_type)

        #Normal torch block (not group invariant) for final 1x1 conv/BN/Relu
        self.plain_torch_block = ActivationBlock(relu_slope=0.1)

        #Dictionary mapping sub-blocks to types (for loading/saving from dictionaries)
        self.named_blocks = {}
        self.named_blocks['input_conv_block'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['conv_block_1'] = TwoStepConvBlock 
        self.named_blocks['conv_block_2'] = TwoStepConvBlock
        self.named_blocks['conv_block_3'] = TwoStepConvBlock
        self.named_blocks['conv_block_4'] = TwoStepConvBlock
        self.named_blocks['conv_block_5'] = TwoStepConvBlock
        self.named_blocks['conv_block_6'] = TwoStepConvBlock
        self.named_blocks['conv_block_7'] = TwoStepConvBlock
        self.named_blocks['conv_block_8'] = TwoStepConvBlock
        self.named_blocks['conv_block_9'] = TwoStepConvBlock
        self.named_blocks['downsample_1'] = DownscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['downsample_2'] = DownscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['downsample_3'] = DownscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['downsample_4'] = DownscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['upscale_1'] = UpscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['upscale_2'] = UpscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['upscale_3'] = UpscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['upscale_4'] = UpscaleBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_1a'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_1'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_2a'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_2'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_3a'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_3'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['reduce_4'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['group_reduce_block'] = ReduceChannelDimsBlock
        self.named_blocks['group_pool_block'] = InteroperableGroupPooling
        self.named_blocks['plain_torch_block'] = ActivationBlock

        #Save to dict + then reload to ensure that all fields are initialized
        self.reload_from_dict(self.get_save_dict())


[docs]    def forward(self, input_tensor):
        """
        This function runs the C8 invariant CNN forwards.

        Arguments
        ----------
            input_tensor: torch.Tensor
                RGB+IR images to put in the model

        Returns
        --------
            output_tensor: torch.tensor
                cloud map
        """
        #Transform input into C8-invariant GeometricTensor
        x = nn.GeometricTensor(input_tensor, self.input_type)

        #Ingest layer
        x = self.input_conv_block(x) #144x144x16

        #Repeatedly downscale
        x = self.conv_block_1(x) #144x144x32
        x = self.downsample_1(x) #72x72x32

        x_cat_72x72 = self.conv_block_2(x) #72x72x64
        x = self.downsample_2(x_cat_72x72) #36x36x64

        x_cat_36x36 = self.conv_block_3(x) #36x36x128
        x = self.downsample_3(x_cat_36x36) #18x18x128

        x_cat_18x18 = self.conv_block_4(x) #18x18x256
        x = self.downsample_4(x_cat_18x18) #9x9x256

        #Bottleneck layer
        x = self.conv_block_5(x) #9x9x512

        #Repeatedly upscale
        x = self.upscale_1(x) #18x18x512
        x = self.reduce_1a(x) #18x18x256

        #Important note: concatenations happen in dimension 1
        #because GeometricTensors have shape (inv_rep, channels, x, y)
        x = nn.tensor_directsum([x, x_cat_18x18]) #18x18x512
        x = self.reduce_1(x) #18x18x128
        x = self.conv_block_6(x) #18x18x256

        x = self.upscale_2(x) #36x36x256
        x = self.reduce_2a(x) #36x36x128
        x = nn.tensor_directsum([x, x_cat_36x36]) #36x36x256
        x = self.reduce_2(x) #36x36x64
        x = self.conv_block_7(x) #36x36x128

        x = self.upscale_3(x) #72x72x128
        x = self.reduce_3a(x) #72x72x64
        x = nn.tensor_directsum([x, x_cat_72x72]) #72x72x128
        x = self.reduce_3(x) #72x72x32
        x = self.conv_block_8(x) #72x72x64

        x = self.upscale_4(x) #144x144x64
        x = self.reduce_4(x) #144x144x16
        x = self.conv_block_9(x) #144x144x32

        #Final C8-invariant layer (goes to torch.tensor)
        x = self.group_reduce_block(x) #144x144x1
        x = self.group_pool_block(x) #144x144x1 torch.tensor

        #Final torch layer
        x = x.tensor #Unwrap GeometricTensor to get PyTorch tensor
        x = self.plain_torch_block(x) #144x144x1 torch.tensor

        return x
